title: 106_hr1440
content: The "Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999" reduces individual income tax rates by 5 percentage points over 10 years. The amendments made by this Act are not considered a change in tax rates for certain purposes. The "Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999" reduces individual income tax rates by 5 percentage points over 10 years. Section 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to impose taxes on married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses based on taxable income. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999 reduces individual income tax rates based on taxable income brackets, with varying percentages and fixed amounts for different income ranges. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999 reduces individual income tax rates based on taxable income brackets, with varying percentages and fixed amounts for different income ranges. Additionally, a tax is imposed on the taxable income of every head of a household according to a specified table. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999 reduces individual income tax rates based on taxable income brackets, with varying percentages and fixed amounts for different income ranges. For unmarried individuals, the tax rates range from 14.5% to 39.6% based on income levels. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999 imposes taxes on unmarried individuals based on taxable income, excluding surviving spouses and heads of households. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999 outlines tax brackets for unmarried individuals based on taxable income, with rates ranging from 14.5% to 39.6%. Married individuals filing separate returns are also subject to these tax brackets. Married individuals filing separate returns are subject to a tax on their taxable income as outlined in the Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999 outlines tax rates based on taxable income brackets, ranging from 14.5% to 39.6%. Married individuals filing separate returns are subject to these tax rates. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999 imposes a tax on the taxable income of estates and trusts according to a specified table. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999 imposes a tax on taxable income of estates and trusts based on a specified table, with varying rates depending on income levels. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999 adjusts the tax brackets for estates and trusts, phasing in a 5 percentage point rate reduction in lower brackets starting in taxable years after 1999. The Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999 adjusts tax brackets for estates and trusts, with a phased-in reduction of 5 percentage points in lower brackets starting in taxable years after 1999. The corresponding percentages for taxable years beginning in the calendar years are as follows: 14.5% and 27.5% for 2000, 14.0% and 27.0% for 2001, 13.5% and 26.5% for 2002, and 13.0% and 26.0% for 2003. The tax brackets for estates and trusts were adjusted by the Tax Rate Reduction Act of 1999, with a phased-in reduction of 5 percentage points in lower brackets starting in taxable years after 1999. The tax rates for taxable years beginning in the calendar years are as follows: 12.5% and 25.5% for 2003, 12.0% and 25.0% for 2004, 11.5% and 24.5% for 2005, 11.0% and 24.0% for 2006, 10.5% and 23.5% for 2007, and 10.0% and 23.0% for 2008 or thereafter. Technical amendments were made to various sections of the Tax Code, including inserting exceptions in subparagraphs, adjusting tax rates, and amending headings. For example, subparagraph (B) of section 1(f)(2) was amended to include exceptions before certain clauses, and subparagraph (C) was amended to include reductions in tax rates. Additionally, the heading for subsection (f) of section 1 was amended to include "Rate Reductions;" before "Adjustments." Subparagraph (B) of section 1(g)(7) was also amended to change the percentage in clause (ii)(II) to "the applicable first bracket percentage." Technical amendments were made to various sections of the Tax Code, including adjusting tax rates and inserting exceptions in subparagraphs. For example, section 1(h) was amended to change the bracket percentages and eliminate certain paragraphs. Section 3402(p)(1)(B) was also amended to adjust the tax percentages. In section 1(c), the tax rates for different income brackets were adjusted. Section 3402(p)(2) and 3402(q)(1) of the Tax Code were also amended to change the applicable percentages for tax payments. Additionally, inflation adjustment conforming amendments were made to subsection (f) of section 1. Subsection (f) of section 1 of the Tax Code is amended to change the year from 1993 to 1999. Various provisions in the Code are also amended to replace the year 1992 with 1998 in multiple sections. The Tax Code is amended to change various sections from 1987 to 1998. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998, and the amendments to withholding provisions apply to amounts paid after the date of the enactment of this Act.
